Great question, both countries are tropical (Japan is almost as hot and humid as the Philippines in the summer time.) both countries are island based. both get nasty typhoons and earth quakes. both are close to China, so why so different? I can think of 4 main factors that separate the two. Confucianism, this was adopted very early on in Japan and became the basis of their educational system and work ethic. Confucianism has a focus on Education and Social Order above anything else.Centralized government. Japan was largely united under a single government from about 7th Century AD. The Philippines was not until quite recently (16th century).Colonization - The Philippines was colonized by the Spanish, then the Americans and then later invaded by the Japanese. Japan has never really been colonized or conquered apart from the Yaoi migrations that happened 300BC - 300 AD.Geography - Though an island country, Japan, from Kyushu to Hokkaido is almost a single contiguous land mass. It is possible to drive from one end of Japan to the other because the islands are so close together. The Philippines on the other hand is broken up into about 10 or so main islands and hundreds of tiny islands. This makes the country harder to govern, administer and educate.
